description: This course immediately precedes the Field Practicum (Social Work 380); in it, majors integrate principles and skills of assessment and planning, develop and implement strategies of ethical intervention with diverse clients with an emphasis on groups and refine skills of termination, evaluation and documentation. Students apply evaluation methods to diverse practice situations, articulate implications of social policy for their practice and demonstrate learning in videotaped role playing. Prerequisite: Social Work 261. Offered in September each year, for majors only.
name: Culturally Comp Pract
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Social Work 261. Offered in September each year, for majors only.
title: Methods and Skills in Social Work III
